page.title: 05Population Changes,Continued
page.content: During the next five centuries the numbers in the villages rose steadily until the late nineteenth and early twentieth century when the numbers were at a maximum. At this time there were more than four hundred adults in{Quenington.} Another indication of the change in the numbers is that at this time each village had its own school with some sixty pupils aged five to eleven.Today there are less than fifty five children in the three villages and only one school. Families have got much smaller; in the school admission register for the last century families of eight or more were quite common. Today the largest family in Hatherop Primary School has four children.
